properties.address: Pantygwydr Baptist Church, West Glamorgan SA2 0HN
properties.description: A wellbeing cafe for adults who feel isolated whether through health, loneliness or just needing company and social contact. We provide a quiet shared space where it's OK to not be OK. There are opportunities to come and share a hobby, learn a new one, enjoy the peace in our quiet area or chat and relax over a cup of tea or coffee. Optional prayer times are held for anyone who would like to join us. We are available Tuesdays between 2.00 pm and 4.00 pm
properties.title: Renew @The Stream

properties.description: Every Monday 1.00pm - 4.00pm - Soup Social and Movie Afternoon - films change weekly. A free partnership session run by Swansea Council's Ageing Well Team, National Waterfront Museum and the Action For Elders Charity. ; Free wifi; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Baby changing facilities; Disabled parking; Refreshments available; warm soup and bread rolls is provided at the halfway point of the film along with tea and coffee before, during and after the film is available, all free; ; Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Television; Advice, information and signposting; staff are on hand to help with advice and guidance and can let you know about the weekly Ageing Well activities taking place across Swansea; we run a number of weekly engagement and wellbeing sessions throughout the week and can sign post people to various support sessions that they are running including social walks, tea and chat sessions, LGBTQ+ sessions, bowling and one-off activities. All sessions are focused on helping people to build new social connections, friendships and to provide a safe space for people to come together and access services easily.; ;

properties.address: 2nd Floor, Art Wings, Grand Theatre, Singleton Street SA1 3QJ
properties.description: Monday to Friday, 9.00am - 5.00pm, Please see our website and follow our Facebook page for updated details. A community hub for Chinese ethnic minority, including migrant, BNO, asylum seekers, any members who are new to Swansea. We are currently operating a drop-in service providing core services such as language services in Mandarin, Cantonese and English, alongside advocacy, information service and case referral. The multicultural hub at the Grand Theatre is a friendly and non-judgemental open place. Visitors can have open conversation with local minority charity organisation and ethnic communities. We would like to create a Swansea Space that allows different background and culture people have opportunity integrate and interaction with local minority communities. ; Free wifi; Free charging points for phones or other devices; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Baby changing facilities; Free period products; Advice, information and signposting:; digital support to resolve smartphone apps issues, how to download and use an app, access online services and information; signposting to local services and information through showing how to search for these online; translate letter or information from English to Chinese language when required; ;
properties.title: Chinese In Wales Association

properties.description: Open as usual over Easter www.pantygwydr.org.uk, https://www.facebook.com/RenewAtTheStream renew.thestream@gmail.com, 01792 459144 Tuesdays 2.00pm - 4.00pm We all have days when we're feeling fed up - problems on our mind, parent, carer, just want some company? Renew@ The Stream offers a warm, safe space of welcome and inclusion aimed at improving emotional wellbeing. Share hobbies and activities, learn something new, make new friends or just take time out with a cup of tea or coffee. Use our quiet space for personal reflection or join us in an optional short time meditating on a Psalm. ; Free wifi; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Baby changing facilities; Games / board games; Refreshments available; free tea, coffee, squash and biscuits and cakes available, pay what you can afford.; ; Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Free period products; Newspapers / magazines; Advice, information and signposting; we base our space around the NHS 5 ways to wellbeing (connect, be active, take notice, keep learning, give) and can work in partnership with local area coordinators, mental health services and third sector bodies to signpost to sources of help.; ;
properties.title: Renew@The Stream at Pantygwydr Baptist Church

properties.address: St Helens Ground, Bryn Road, Brynmill SA2 0AR
properties.description: Open as usual over Easter www.swanseaveteranshub.org.uk/our-services, Facebook Swansea Veterans Hub, Twitter @swanseaveterans, Instagram Swansea_veterans_hub info@swanseaveteranshub.org.uk, 07916 227 411 / 07894 417 590 Open every Saturday 10.00am - 12.00pm, Tuesday 10.00am - 1.00pm, for breakfast (Saturdays), snacks, tea and coffee sessions. Support is available. A very friendly welcome to a large room with a beautiful view of Swansea Bay. Our drop in hub holds coffee mornings where vulnerable veterans and safe, warm, space attendees can come together in a non-threatening, comfortable environment, allowing our specialist volunteers to identify those most at risk, offer them wellbeing strategies, and signpost them to alternative therapies and treatments. ; Free charging points for phones or other devices; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Car parking; Games / board games; Outdoor space; Refreshments available; free tea and coffee available, breakfast on Saturdays; ; Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Television; Advice, information and signposting; Swansea Veterans' Hub (SVH) is a CIC formed 24 August 2021. The hub operates in partnership with several local organisations to provide mental health and wellbeing support and signposting for veterans, their families and safe, warm space attendees.; ;
properties.title: Swansea Veterans Hub

properties.description: Closed during Easter school holidays www.llanrhidian.swansea.sch.uk/caffi-cynefin/ caswelld5@hwbmail.net, 01792 390181 We are open every term time Thursday, 9.00am - 11.45am. Caffi Cynefin aims to bring people together promoting positivity, kindness and a sense of belonging. This Caffi is run by our wonderful pupils who are gaining experiences of the "real world of work". Come and join us! Caffi Cynefin is a place where all generations come together to relax, enjoy and reflect. We do not charge for our refreshments, but we will depend on donations to make this a sustainable and long term commitment. If you would like to volunteer or make any donations, please contact the school. ; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Refreshments available; we serve tea, coffee, squash, a selection of cakes, crumpets, teacakes and have a weekly healthy option available (but most prefer the cakes). We do not charge!; 5 star food hygiene rating; ; Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Advice, information and signposting; most weeks our Local Area Co-ordinator and local police often attend to offer support and advice; ;
